{"blocks":[{"key":"csi61","text":"Materials and Reagents: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch905","text":"    -Dithizone (Sigma-Aldrich), cat # D-5130","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5qgr","text":"    -Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jdov","text":"    -1mL Syringe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uu27","text":"    -30mm Syringe filter 0.46um nylon membrane","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab8sa","text":"    -Microscope with a micrometer in the scope to measure the diameter of the islets","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hfim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9lfn","text":"Procedure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g6ot","text":"Dissolve 10 mg of DTZ in 4 mL of DMSO. Add 36mL of HBSS (or any medium without serum). You can aliquot this solution and keep it frozen. Before using, filter and add a few drops to the medium where your islets are. Keep for up to 1 week at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4o9a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vbvg","text":"To count islet equivalence:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbqko","text":"    -Resuspend the islets in a known volume (25-50mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50l0g","text":"    -Take three or more samples of 50 or 100uL and put them on a dish (make sure to mix the islets well before sampling and sample quickly, as they fall to the bottom of the tube fast).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdd4p","text":"    -Count all the islets in the sample and separate the islets by size ranges by their diameter (50-100um, 100-150um, 200-250um, etc.). Write them on the provided sheet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acgf1","text":"    -Convert each size range with the conversion factor. Add up the numbers and multiply by the dilution factor to get a total number. This is based on volume and converting all the islets to how many there would be if they were all 150um in diameter. This means that you need six 50um islets to equal one 150um islet when you remember that volume is 4/3πr^3.     \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":359,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df5o0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mbr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Disperse Islets, Ducts and Acinar Into Single Cells
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"5fa9l","text":"Materials and Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53o81","text":"    -Phosphate-Buffered Saline (PBS) without calcium and magnesium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmug2","text":"    -TrypLETM Express [-] Phenol Red","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":11,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nsno","text":"    -Water bath at 37°C
    -Vortex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a140","text":"    -Centrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv1nm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tfb2","text":"Procedure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a8a6","text":"    -Collect islets, ducts, or acinar + medium from dish to an individual 15mL tube. Centrifuge at 1.5 rpm for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c65iq","text":"    -Aspirate PBS and add 10mL of PBS. Centrifuge at 1.5 rpm for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6192u","text":"    -Aspirate PBS and add an appropriate amount of TrypLETM (e.g., 750uL in about 1,000 islets. Acinar cells would need more. Add enough TrypLETM to cover the tissue).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":57,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":143,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nmm3","text":"    -Bring tubes to water bath at 37°C for 10 minutes. Vortex tubes in each 3 minutes for 10 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faeee","text":"    -Stop TrypLETM   reaction by adding cold media (complete the tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aqpe","text":"    -EVERYTHING ON ICE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bobdi","text":"    -Centrifuge at 2 rpm for 2 minutes. Centrifuge at 2 rpm for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52rhc","text":"    -Aspirate medium and add appropriate volume of pre-warmed medium to culture cells into 24-well plate (1mL per well).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7elnp","text":"    -Add 1x Cell Pre-Treatment Solution. Incubate at 37°C for 2 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejnl5","text":"    -Collect aliquots of each sample to be the unstained (do not add SA-b-Gal Substrate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73o51","text":"    -Add 1x SA-b-Gal Substrate directly to the cells. steps.section: Attachment and Staining Protocol for Human Pancreatic Tissue (Islets, Ducts, Acinar)
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"f389u","text":"1. Glass bottom dishes were treated with 1X PEI for at least 24hrs in a 37°C incubator
then left in the fridge prior to attachment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1a984","text":"
2. Cells were dispersed according to protocol and an aliquot of 200-300uL of media with
dispersed cells was attached to the treated dish and allowed to sit overnight
in a 37°C incubator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41jba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ljqo","text":"3. Next day, cells were washed with 1X PBS-Calcium/Magnesium Free one time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qre3","text":"
4. Cells fixed with 10% Formalin for 30 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhlp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r241","text":"5. Cells washed with 1X PBS three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fm95f","text":"
6. Cells incubated with 0.3% Triton-X for 15 min at room temperature.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"addiq","text":"7. Cells washed with 1X PBS with 2% Lamb Serum three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q5at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gnfa","text":"8. Cells incubated with Normal Donkey Serum (1:50 in PBS) for 45 min at room
temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"862q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dskl9","text":"9. Cells washed with 1x PBS with 2% Lamb Serum one time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nd8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58mm1","text":"10. Cells incubated with Rabbit anti-HMGB1 antibody (1:400 in PBS) overnight at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uc3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77jom","text":"11. Next day, cells taken out and allowed to “defrost” for 1 hour at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch7au","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ji8g","text":"12. Cells washed with PBS with 2% Lamb Serum three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oifh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ofns","text":"13. Cells incubated with 488 anti-Rabbit (1:200 in PBS) for 1 hour at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d59p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"urgp","text":"14. Cells washed with PBS with 2% Lamb Serum three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1guq3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f064n","text":"15. Cells incubated with Guinea Pig anti-Insulin (1:200 in PBS) for 2 hours at room

Cells washed with PBS with 2% Lamb Serum three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2qua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57eq2","text":"17. Cells incubated with 594 anti-Guinea Pig (1:200 in PBS) for 1 hour at room
temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1opdv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg9uj","text":"18. Cells washed with 1X PBS three times.
